The ritualist must collect the blood of a murdered humanoid in a small bottle and perform daily incantations, which can take up to 14 days. Once the polong forms, they drink the blood of their creator every day, most often taken from a finger inserted into their bottle. At the master's order, a polong will travel up to 10 miles away to locate a particular person, possess them, and either slowly whittle them down via possession until they die, or force them to attack anyone nearby until someone slays the victim in self-defense.

action->Lifesense 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]
Lifesense 30 feet

action->Bottle Bound.name: Bottle Bound
action->Bottle Bound.description: A polong is bound to the bottle from which they spawned. They can leave the bottle only at the will of their master and must return to it once every 24 hours to feed on their creator's blood. Otherwise, the polong withers and dies.

action->Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
action->Natural Invisibility.description: A polong is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} outside of their bottle. They become visible only when forced out of a possessed creature against their will. Shattering the polong's bottle also forces them to assume a visible form.

action->Regenerating Bond.name: Regenerating Bond
action->Regenerating Bond.description: When a polong possesses a creature, the polong's master gains temporary Hit Points equal to the victim's level × the victim's drained value caused by the possession. These temporary Hit Points last as long as the possession lasts.

action->Polong Possession.name: Polong Possession
action->Polong Possession.description:
The polong attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell (@Check[type:will|dc:26]), except the duration is 24 hours and, since the polong doesn't have a physical body, they're unaffected by that restriction of the spell. If the target has critically failed its save and become fully possessed by this polong before, it gets a save result one degree of success worse than it rolled.

A creature possessed by a polong becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. These conditions don't reduce naturally unless the polong spends an entire day without possessing the creature. For each consecutive day the polong is able to return and possess the creature, the drained and doomed values each increase by 1, to a maximum of 4. If the polong possesses a different creature, the conditions end for any creature it previously possessed.

action->Rend.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

Scythe Claw

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

Predatory Rabbit.name: Predatory Rabbit
Predatory Rabbit.publicNotes:
Skittish in life, predatory rabbits are fast and nimble predators in unassuming forms. They most enjoy hunting birds, squirrels, cats, and other rabbits.

Bonds of loyalty that endure beyond death reanimate pets to crawl from their graves within days of dying, returning to the side of their past owners, family, or pack. Unfortunately, death irrevocably changes a risen pet. They return as aggressive, predatory beasts, difficult to control and easy to anger. Even the most friendly and docile of pets becomes sadistic and violent in undeath—fixating first on those it views as competition for the attention of its owners. When a risen pet is jilted, rebuffed, or offended by its owner, it turns on them.

action->Sense Companion.name: Sense Companion
action->Sense Companion.description: A predatory rabbit knows the direction of its past owner or family (as long as they're both on the same plane), but not the distance.

action->Stench.name: Stench
action->Stench.description: 10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:13] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

action->Feral Leap.name: Feral Leap
action->Feral Leap.description: The predatory rabbit jumps with a maximum height and distance each equal to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions. At any point, the predatory rabbit attempts a jaws Strike.

Priest Of Kabriri.name: Priester Kabriris
Priest Of Kabriri.publicNotes:
Eine beträchtliche Anzahl mächtiger Wesenheiten hat um den den Titel des Schutzpatrons der Untoten gewetteifert, aber keine von ihnen wird von den Ghulen mehr verehrt als der Dämonenherrscher @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.V5PbbkZUP9N7kl6h]{Kabriri}, auch bekannt als „Der Nagende“. Fast alle Ghule, die noch dazu neigen, Götter zu verehren, widmen sich Kabriri, der durch profane Rituale und makabre Zeremonien geehrt wird, in deren Mittelpunkt der gefräßige Verzehr von Lebewesen steht. Diese Liturgien werden von den Priestern Kabriris geleitet, besonders abscheulichen und gerissenen Ghulen, die von ihrem Urvater speziell damit beauftragt wurden, dafür zu sorgen, dass seine zahlreichen Nachkommen niemals hungern müssen.

Ghule sind hinterhältig und gerissen und überall dort zu finden, wo Leichen ruhen, denn sie sind stets auf der Suche nach neuen Opfern, um ihre grenzenlose Gier nach humanoidem Fleisch zu stillen.

action->Ecstatic Ululation.name: Ekstatisches Heulen
action->Ecstatic Ululation.description:
Auslöser Ein verbündeter Ghul innerhalb von 30 Fuß/9 m Reichweite nutzt die Aktion Fleisch verzehren, um TP zu regenerieren

Effekt Der Priester von Kabriri stößt ein verzücktes Heulen zum Lob seines Gottes aus. Alle Ghule im Umkreis von @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 Fuß/9 m} um den Priester von Kabriri - einschließlich des Priesters, aber nicht des auslösenden Ghuls - erhalten die Hälfte der wiedererlangten Trefferpunkte des auslösenden Ghuls zurück. Alle lebenden Kreaturen im Umkreis von 30 Fuß/9 m erleiden Leerenschaden in Höhe der Hälfte der Trefferpunkte, die der auslösende Ghul wiedergewonnen hat (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true]{einfacher Zähigkeitswurf}). Eine Fähigkeit Fleisch verzehren kann lediglich ein Ekstatisches Heulen eines Priesters Kabriris auslösen. Alle weiteren haben keinen Effekt mehr.

action->Ghoul Fever.name: Ghulfieber
action->Ghoul Fever.description:
Rettungswurf @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Phase 1 Erkrankt ohne Nebeneffekte (1 Tag)

Phase 2 @Damage[2d6[void]]{2W6 Punkte Seelenschaden} und erlangt durch Heilung nur die Hälfte an Trefferpunkten (1 Tag)

Phase 3 Wie Phase 2 (1 Tag)

Phase 4 @Damage[2d6[void]]{2W6 Punkte Seelenschaden} und erlangt keine Vorteile mehr durch Heilung (1 Tag)

Phase 5 Wie Phase 4 (1 Tag)

Phase 6 Tot, erhebt sich zur nächsten Mitternacht als @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghul}

action->Paralysis.name: Lähmung
action->Paralysis.description: Wird eine lebende, nichtelfische Kreatur vom Angriff eines Ghuls getroffen, muss sie einen @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]{Zähigkeitswurf} ablegen; bei einem Fehlschlag erleidet sie den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Gelähmt}. Der Kreatur steht am Ende jedes ihrer Züge ein erneuter Rettungswurf zu; der SG sinkt dabei kumulativ mit jedem dieser Rettungswürfe um 1.

action->Swift Leap.name: Schneller Sprung
action->Swift Leap.description: Der Ghul legt im Sprung maximal seine halbe Bewegungsrate zurück. Diese Bewegung löst keine Reaktionen aus.

Provincial Jiang-shi.name: Provincial Jiang-shi
Provincial Jiang-shi.hpDetails: fast healing 10, void healing, one more breath
Provincial Jiang-shi.publicNotes:
Jiang-shi are terrifying hopping vampires from Tian Xia. Though similar to other vampires—they are undead, drain vital energy from the living, and can be slain only in specific ways—jiang-shi feast upon the breath of the living, also known as qi or ki, instead of blood. While they possess unique powers, including their magic-deflecting paper fulus, extraordinary jumping ability, and immunity to sunlight, jiang-shi also possess unique vulnerabilities, such as the inability to see living creatures save through breathsense, a revulsion to bells and mirrors, and near-stupefying melancholia. Thankfully, most jiang-shi can't create vampiric spawn.

Roused rudely from their nightmarish slumber, the provincial jiang-shi roams the villages and graveyards around their domain searching for sustenance to slake their hunger.

action->Breathsense (Precise) 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.OSnNiMdqgARyEVuv]
Breathsense (Precise) 60 feet

action->Fast Healing 10.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]
Fast Healing 10

action->Jiang-Shi Vulnerabilities.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.R1vYhCJ2KvT8uAy1]
Jiang-Shi Vulnerabilities

action->One More Breath.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BBqjQN5Gbe4PWP56]
One More Breath

action->Warped Fulu.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.hwrZQSADT36TjDdv]
Warped Fulu

action->Drain Qi.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QMlQ5AvcunCvjlfM]
Drain Qi
action->Drain Qi.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QMlQ5AvcunCvjlfM]

Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the jiang-shi's reach

Effect The jiang-shi drains the victim's life energy, or qi, through their breath. This requires an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the jiang-shi regains [[/r 13[healing]]]{13 HP}, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining qi from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the jiang-shi but increases the victim's drained condition value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. If the victim has the ability to cast ki spells, it can spend 1 Focus Point to avoid becoming drained. This protects it only from the current attack, not from subsequent attempts to Drain Qi.

A victim's drained condition value decreases by 1 every week. If the creature restricts their diet to glutinous rice for at least 1 day and spends 10 minutes dancing, jogging, or otherwise engaging in vigorous physical activity by succeeding at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:25] check, it reduces its drained condition by 1.

action->Rigor Mortis.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.O6AXB9aZB0K14sS5]
Rigor Mortis

Prowler Wight.name: Pirschergruftschrecken
Prowler Wight.publicNotes:
Die Pirschergruftschrecken lauern oft in der Dunkelheit und nutzen die Täuschung als ihre größte Waffe. Sie spielen ihren Tod häufig in alten Abwasserkanälen, Friedhöfen und Mausoleen vor und warten darauf, dass ahnungslose Opfer vorbeikommen, bevor sie zuschlagen.

Gruftschrecken sind untote, bösartige Wesen, die sich vor allem an Orte begeben, die mit dem Tod zu tun haben.

action->Final Spite.name: Trotziger Schlag
action->Final Spite.description:
Auslöser Der Pirschergruftschrecken wird auf 0 Trefferpunkte reduziert

Effekt Der Pirschergruftschrecken führt vor seinem Tod einen letzten Angriff aus. Er erhält dadurch keine TP durch die Fähigkeit Lebenskraft entziehen zurück.

action->Drain Life.name: Lebenskraft entziehen
action->Drain Life.description: Wenn der Gruftschrecken eine lebende Kreatur mit einem Waffenlosen Angriff oder seiner gebundenen Waffe verletzt, erhält er vorübergehend 9 Temporäre Trefferpunkte und die Kreatur muss einen @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]{Zähigkeitswurf} bestehen, um nicht den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Ausgelaugt 1} zu erhalten. Bei weiterem Schaden, den der Gruftschrecken mit seinem Waffenlosen Angriff oder seiner gebundenen Waffe verursacht, erhöht sich der Wert des Zustandes Ausgelaugt bei einem misslungenen Rettungswurf um 1, bis zu einem Maximum von Ausgelaugt 4.

action->Feign Death.name: Todstellen
action->Feign Death.description: Der Pirschergruftschrecken löscht das verräterische rote Glühen in seinen Augenhöhlen, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{fällt auf den Boden} und liegt völlig still. Bis zum Zeitpunkt seiner nächsten Handlung erscheint der Gruftschrecken wie ein gewöhnlicher Leichnam. Das Ergebnis von Fertigkeitswürfen für Täuschung und der SG, um als gewöhnlicher Leichnam durchzugehen, beträgt automatisch 38.

action->Sneak Attack.description: Der Pirschergruftschrecken verursacht bei Kreaturen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß} zusätzlich 2W6 Punkte Stichschaden.

action->Spawn Prowler Wight.name: Pirschergruftschreckensbrut
action->Spawn Prowler Wight.description: Ein lebender Humanoider, der durch einen Waffen- oder Klauenschlag eines Pirschergruftschreckens getötet wurde, erhebt sich nach [[/br 1d4 #Runden]]{1W4 Runden} als Pirschergruftschreckensbrut. Dieser Gruftschrecken steht unter dem Kommando des Jägers, der ihn getötet hat. Diese Bruten verfügen weder über die Fähigkeit Lebenskraft zu entziehen, noch über Pirschergruftschreckenbrut und tragen so lange den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 2}, wie sie eine Pirschergruftschreckenbrut sind. Wenn der Erschaffer des Pirschergruftschreckens stirbt, wird die Gruftschreckenbrut zu einem völlig autonomen Pirschergruftschrecken; er erhält seinen freien Willen zurück, kann Lebenskraft entziehen und weitere Pirschergruftschreckenbrut hervorbringen; zudem leidet er nicht mehr am Zustand Unbeholfen.

Queen Sluagh.name: Queen Sluagh
Queen Sluagh.publicNotes:
A queen sluagh grows more powerful by devouring souls collected from underlings or drained directly through her proboscis. The muscular tongue inside is tipped with a cartilaginous, barbed quill that feeds the queen not only the soul, but the strengths of its owner. A queen conceals her nest deep in a secluded area, such as a forest or graveyard.

A soul about to leave its physical body gives off a peculiar scent, usually unnoticed by mortal creatures. But the undead fey called sluagh can smell and track down its location with frightening ease. Unlike most fey, sluagh are undead, possessing strong connections to void energy and mortal souls. Sluagh collect the souls of those close to death and bring them to feed their queen.

Most sluagh appear bald-headed, with rounded ears, sharp teeth, glossy black eyes, and scrawny bodies. Their rib cages show through their skin, which is translucent and soft as velvet.

Sluagh can become ghostly and incorporeal for brief periods. They use this power to stalk their prey to great effect. Sometimes the glimpse of a sluagh is mistaken for a ghost sighting.

spell->Visions of Danger (A Swarm of Slu.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jBGAYmR0BkkbpJvG]
Visions of Danger (A Swarm of Sluagh Reapers)

action->Frightful Presence.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]

120 feet. @Check[type:will|dc:37]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

action->Soulscent (Imprecise) 200 feet.name: Soulscent (Imprecise) 200 feet
action->Soulscent (Imprecise) 200 feet.description: The sluagh is aware of all doomed creatures, dying creatures, and creatures that died within the last hour within the listed range.

action->Voice of the Soul.name: Voice of the Soul
action->Voice of the Soul.description: A sluagh queen knows any language of a creature whose soul they've devoured and can perfectly mimic its voice by attempting a Deception check to Lie, with a +4 circumstance bonus.

action->Call of the Damned.name: Call of the Damned
action->Call of the Damned.description: The queen sends out shriek to all sluagh within 1 mile, summoning them to her. This typically calls [[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.book-of-the-dead-bestiary.Actor.uURI8Netd0ytD9vc]{Sluagh Reapers}. If the queen is facing foes strong enough to threaten her, these are likely too weak to pose a threat but can assist by fetching items or getting in enemies' way.

action->Eat Soul.name: Eat Soul
action->Eat Soul.description: The queen touches a dying creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour with her proboscis. If the target is dying, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save; on a failure, its dying value increases by 2 (3 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, the queen devours the soul. Unless the queen is destroyed, the target can't be returned to life through any means, even powerful magic such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}.

action->Ghostly Swoop.name: Ghostly Swoop
action->Ghostly Swoop.description:
The queen sluagh becomes incorporeal until the start of their next turn, and Flies up to their fly Speed. While incorporeal, they are immune to precision damage, and have resistance 10 to all damage (except force, ghost touch, or vitality); this resistance is doubled against non-magical damage.

After using Ghostly Swoop, the queen sluagh can't use it again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Soul Theft.name: Soul Theft
action->Soul Theft.description:
Requirements The queen has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} with her proboscis

Effect The queen devours a portion of the creature's soul and steals some of its ability. The creature takes @Damage[5d8[void]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save). The queen gains temporary HP equal to the total amount of HP the target loses, including any HP lost from being drained.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is drained 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. The queen steals a spell slot or training. If she steals a spell from a prepared caster, she transfers the spell to herself; if she steals from a spontaneous caster, she gains a prepared spell of the appropriate rank and expends one of the creature's spell slots of that rank. If she steals training, she chooses Perception, attack modifier, or any skill. For 24 hours, she gains a +2 status bonus to that statistic and the creature takes a -2 status penalty. The queen can have any number of stolen abilities, but only one from each creature.

Critical Failure As failure, but double damage.

Raw Nerve.name: Abnormes Nervengeflecht
Raw Nerve.languages: (kann keine Sprachen sprechen); Telepathie 100 Fuß/30 m
Raw Nerve.publicNotes:
Wenn ein Lebewesen durch hohe Mengen an Elektrizität getötet wird (z. B. durch einen Blitzschlag oder einen magischen Angriff), führt der Schrecken des Sterbens manchmal dazu, dass seine Seele auf der materiellen Ebene verweilt. Nekromantische Energie ergreift ihr Gehirn und ihr Nervensystem, wodurch diese Organe aus dem verkohlten Fleisch hervorbrechen und zu einem Abnormen Nervengeflecht werden. Diese schrecklichen Untoten schweben einige Zentimeter über dem Boden in einer makabren Anordnung, welche die lebende Form der Kreatur auf morbide Weise parodiert, mit dem Gehirn an der Spitze und den Nerven, die darunter baumeln und vor elektrischer Energie knistern.

Ein Abnormes Nervengeflecht kann die Gedanken der Lebenden wahrnehmen und empfindet sie als ein chaotisches Durcheinander, das eine unkontrollierbare Wut hervorruft. Der Untote versucht, die Quellen dieser Gedanken zu zerstören, was oft bedeutet, dass er jedes lebende Wesen tötet, das er wahrnehmen kann. Sobald ein Abnormes Nervengeflecht keine Gedanken mehr wahrnimmt, wird es still und schwebt in einem fast meditativen Zustand. Allerdings erwacht seine Wut sofort wieder, wenn ihm ein denkendes Lebewesen zu nahekommt. Ein Abnormes Nervengeflecht ist zwar nicht geistlos, aber man kann nicht mit ihm reden - die einzige Möglichkeit es zu stoppen besteht darin, es zu zerstören.

action->Thoughtsense 60 feet.name: Gedankengespür 60 Fuß/18 m
action->Thoughtsense 60 feet.description: Das Abnorme Nervengeflecht kann sämtliche nichtgeistlose Kreaturen innerhalb der angegebenen Reichweite wahrnehmen.

action->Accelerating Inquest.name: Beschleunigende Untersuchung
action->Accelerating Inquest.description: Das Abnorme Nervengeflecht untersucht eine Kreatur im Umkreis von 100 Fuß/30 m auf mentale Weise; dazu legt es einen Fertigkeitswurf für @Check[type:occultism|defense:will]{Okkultismus} gegen den Willens-SG seines Ziels ab. Bei einem Erfolg kann das Abnorme Nervengeflecht die Aktion Schritt nutzen und gewinnt bis zum Ende seines nächsten Zuges einen Situationsbonus von +2 auf seine RK gegen diese Kreatur.

action->Float.name: Schweben
action->Float.description: Ein Abnormes Nervengeflecht schwebt einige Zentimeter über dem Boden. Deshalb ignoriert es Schwieriges Gelände.

action->Involuntary Reaction.name: Unfreiwillige Reaktion
action->Involuntary Reaction.description: Eine von den Nervenenden eines Abnormen Nervengeflechts getroffene Kreatur muss einen erfolgreichen @Check[type:reflex|dc:26]{Reflexwurf} ablegen, um nicht bis zum Beginn dessen nächsten Zuges die Fähigkeit zur Nutzung von Reaktionen zu verlieren.

action->Synaptic Overload.name: Synapsenüberladung
action->Synaptic Overload.description:
Das Abnorme Nervengeflecht entfesselt eine Explosion mentaler Energie in einem @Template[type:cone|distance:30]{30 Fuß/9-m-Kegel}. Kreaturen innerhalb des Wirkungsbereiches erleiden @Damage[4d12[mental]]{4W12 Punkte Mentalen Schaden} (@Check[type:will|dc:23]{Willenswurf}).

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur erleidet keinen Schaden.

Erfolg Die Kreatur erleidet nur den halben Schaden.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erleidet den vollen Schaden sowie den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 1}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erleidet den doppelten Schaden sowie den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 2}.

lore->Lore.name: Kenntnis (eine beliebige Kenntnis, die der Untote zu Lebzeiten beherrscht hat)

Relictner Eroder.name: Relictner Eroder
Relictner Eroder.publicNotes:
Regardless of age, relictners look like ancient dwarves with deep wrinkles, sparse white hair, and decrepit forms. As their bodies degrade, so too do their surroundings, with even the finest architecture crumbling to ruins.

Mortics are humanoids overwhelmed by void energy who tenaciously cling to life, straddling the line between living and dead.

weapon->Dwarven War Axe (Broken).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MYnh7w7EL3AcQT41]
Dwarven War Axe (Broken)

armor->Chain Mail (Broken).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Kf4eJEXnFPuAsseP]
Chain Mail (Broken)

action->Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
action->Consecration Vulnerability.description: A relictner in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y3jlOfgsQH1JjkJE]{Sanctified Ground}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

action->Lair Sense.name: Lair Sense
action->Lair Sense.description: The relictner bonds with a single structure they consider their lair, such as a house, temple, or ruin. A relictner is aware of any creature that enters the lair, and the direction and approximate distance to the creature. If the lair is destroyed, the relictner can bond with a new lair by residing within a structure they own or claim for 1 week.

action->Weathering Aura.name: Weathering Aura
action->Weathering Aura.description: 60 feet. The relictner radiates an aura of degradation. All objects in the area have their Hardness reduced by 10, to a minimum of 0, for as long as they remain in the aura and for 1 round after leaving it. The relictner can't deactivate this aura.

action->Crumble.name: Crumble
action->Crumble.description: The relictner erodes an object within 30 feet, dealing @Damage[3d10[bludgeoning]] damage to it, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true] if the object is attended.

action->Death Gasp.name: Death Gasp
action->Death Gasp.description:
The relictner draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The relictner gains the undead trait and becomes immune to bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, poison, and sleep. Any such effects the relictner is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath.

Death Gasp lasts as long as the relictner holds their breath (up to 12 rounds).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lyeRL7khixdlJsaf]{Effect: Death Gasp}

action->Demolition.name: Demolition
action->Demolition.description:
The relictner bellows in fury, causing the surrounding structure to collapse. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]] damage from falling debris (@Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true]). A creature that fails its save is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The area becomes difficult terrain.

The relictner can't use Demolition again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Demolition]]{1d4 rounds}.

Runecarved Lich.name: Runecarved Lich
Runecarved Lich.publicNotes:
In their relentless pursuit of more magical might, some liches use their rotting forms to hold magical secrets, hiding precious tomes in their ribcage, inscribing formulas on their withered flesh, even replacing some bones with powerful magical items. The process is painstaking, as the soul cage tries to repair any damage caused by such alterations.

A desire to live eternally motivates a spellcaster to become a lich, and necromantic knowledge makes the desire real. The typical lich takes the most direct path, keeping their undead form fairly close to their appearance in life. But undeath can also bring greater freedom for those with a less conventional view of what they can become. The horde lich and runecarved lich reshape themselves entirely.

equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (7t.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WeX7rAO2kAyP0QnG]
Wand of Manifold Missiles (7th-Level Spell)
equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (7t.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WeX7rAO2kAyP0QnG]

This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} at 7th rank.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate rank.

consumable->Wand of Wall of Force (Level.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.kiXh4SUWKr166ZeM]
Wand of Wall of Force (Level 6)
consumable->Wand of Wall of Force (Level.consumableSpellDescription:
You form an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} wall of pure magical force up to 50 feet long and up to 20 feet high. The wall has no discernible thickness. You must create the wall in an unbroken open space so its edges don't pass through any creatures or objects, or the spell is lost. The wall has AC 10, Hardness 30, and 60 Hit Points, and it's immune to critical hits and precision damage. The wall blocks physical effects from passing through it, and because it's made of force, it blocks incorporeal and ethereal creatures as well. Teleportation effects can pass through the barrier, as can visual effects (since the wall is invisible). Wall of force is immune to counteracting effects of its level or lower, but the wall is automatically destroyed by a disintegrate spell of any level or by contact with a rod of cancellation or sphere of annihilation.

Heightened (+2) The Hit Points of the wall increases by 20.
consumable->Wand of Wall of Force (Level.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.kiXh4SUWKr166ZeM]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Iela4GgVeO3LfAo]{Wall of Force}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kquBnQ0kObZztnBc]
+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Frightful Presence.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]

60 feet. @Check[type:will|dc:38]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

action->Rejuvenation.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.a7A4xY3NeWI2Ya4Z]
Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.a7A4xY3NeWI2Ya4Z]

When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.

action->Spellstealing Counter.name: Spellstealing Counter
action->Spellstealing Counter.description:
Trigger A creature the lich can see Casts a Spell

Requirements The runecarved lich has fewer than three spells stored in its spell tome

Effect The lich expends a spell slot of the same rank as the spell being cast to counter the triggering creature's casting. The runecarved lich loses their spell slot as if they'd cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell (counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+35#Counteract]]{+35}). If successful, the spell is countered and added to the runecarved lich's spell tome.

action->Stored Items.name: Stored Items
action->Stored Items.description:
The runecarved lich can store items inside its body, as detailed below. The lich can Interact to remove or store an item. If the lich's body is destroyed, any stored items appear among their bones.

  • Arm Wands (extradimensional) The runecarved lich can store up to two wands in the radius and ulna of one of their arms. These wands can be used as if wielded, and they can't be disarmed. If an arm wand is overcharged, the lich takes 20 damage if the wand is broken or 40 if it's destroyed.
  • Spell Tome A runecarved lich has a carefully crafted tome, filled with magical power, placed inside their ribcage. This tome can hold up to three spells stolen by the Spellstealing Counter ability.
  • Stored Weapon (extradimensional)The lich can store a single one-handed weapon of 1 Bulk or less, linked to special runes carved into the bones of one of the lich's arms. This runecarved lich has the battle axe listed in its items, but a different individual might have a different weapon. A weapon the lich wields deals additional damage equal to half the number of dice from its hand attack.

action->Consult the Text.name: Consult the Text
action->Consult the Text.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The runecarved lich causes the pages of their spell tome to flip open, revealing an occult spell of 9th rank or lower of their choice. For the remainder of the day, the lich can cast that spell as if it were one of their spells known for every level from its base level up to 9th.

action->Drain Spell Tome.name: Drain Spell Tome
action->Drain Spell Tome.description: Effect The lich draws upon the magic stored in their spell tome to cast one of the spells they've countered. This spell is the same level as the one countered, but it uses the runecarved lich's spell DC and spell attack. Casting a spell in this way removes it from the spell tome.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the runecarved lich's spellcasting action, the lich attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

action->Summon Weapon.name: Summon Weapon
action->Summon Weapon.description:
Requirements The lich has a stored weapon in its arm and has that hand free

Effect The runecarved lich summons its stored weapon into that arm's hand.

Sadistic Conductor.name: Sadistic Conductor
Sadistic Conductor.description: A phantom conductor appears with a flourish, causing spectral instruments with razor-like strings to appear in the hands of those present. As the conductor gestures for the performance to begin, creatures are compelled to play the instruments.
Sadistic Conductor.disable: @Check[type:perfomance|dc:18] to perform so well the conductor releases you from your instrument, banishing it voluntarily; @Check[type:occultism|dc:22] (trained) or @Check[type:religion|dc:22] (trained) to banish one instrument; or @Check[type:thievery|dc:25] (trained) to sabotage one instrument; each instrument must be banished, sabotaged, or destroyed to disable the haunt
Sadistic Conductor.reset: The haunt deactivates when all conjured instruments are destroyed or there has been silence for 1 minute. It resets after 1 hour.
Sadistic Conductor.routine: (1 action; enchantment, mental, occult) The conductor urges each creature within 30 feet to play the hazardous instrument it holds. Each creature that is compelled to play its instrument does so, and those who succeeded on their save can choose to do so. Playing the instrument, either from the haunt's routine or of a creature's own volition during an attempt to disable the haunt, deals @Damage[(1d6+3)[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|traits:enchantment,mental,occult] save), and the creature must attempt a @Check[type:performance|dc:18|traits:enchantment,mental,occult,damaging-effect] check. On a success, the conductor accepts the performance and dismisses that creature's instrument, and on a critical failure, the discordant sound and conductor's jeers deal an additional @Damage[(1d6+3)[sonic]] damage.

action->Conjure Instruments.name: Conjure Instruments
action->Conjure Instruments.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 15 feet

Effect The conductor conjures a hazardous spectral instrument into the hands of each sentient creature within 30 feet. Even a creature whose hands are full finds a spectral instrument superimposed over the other items it's carrying. Affected creatures must each attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The conjuration fails and no instrument appears in the creature's hands.

Success A conjured instrument appears in the creature's hands, but it isn't compelled to play it.

Failure A conjured instrument appears in the creature's hands and it's compelled to play it. The creature can't willingly put down the instrument while compelled to play.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature needs a critical success on its Performance in order for the conductor to be satisfied and dismiss its instrument.

Scorned Hound.name: Scorned Hound
Scorned Hound.publicNotes:
Scorned hounds rise from the most devoted dogs. They're incredibly possessive of their owners, allowing no living beings to approach and refusing to be parted.

Bonds of loyalty that endure beyond death reanimate pets to crawl from their graves within days of dying, returning to the side of their past owners, family, or pack. Unfortunately, death irrevocably changes a risen pet. They return as aggressive, predatory beasts, difficult to control and easy to anger. Even the most friendly and docile of pets becomes sadistic and violent in undeath—fixating first on those it views as competition for the attention of its owners. When a risen pet is jilted, rebuffed, or offended by its owner, it turns on them.

action->Sense Companion.name: Sense Companion
action->Sense Companion.description: A scorned hound knows the direction of its past owner or family (as long as they're both on the same plane), but not the distance.

action->Stench.name: Stench
action->Stench.description: 15 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

action->Betray the Pack.name: Betray the Pack
action->Betray the Pack.description: The hound's Strikes deal 1d4 additional damage to creatures that were once its owner, companion, fellow pet, family, household, or pack.

Seetangeist.name: Seetangeist
Seetangeist.publicNotes:
Seetangeists are composed of the bloated corpses of marine life, encrusted with bleached coral and wrapped in rotting seaweed. Although occasionally created by water-breathing necromancers, seetangeists most often arise when an aquatic ecosystem collapses, resulting in the deaths of countless creatures. Bound by spiritual trauma, these corpses merge together, forming a writhing school of flesh and decaying plant matter that seeks out and consumes what life remains in the region.

The disasters that lead to the creation of seetangeists are typically caused by mortal interference: overhunting, ecological overexploitation, pollution, or necromantic magic and experimentation.

When disaster befalls the natural world, a different kind of undead may rise, entirely unlike risen humanoids. Most plants, fish, insects, and other animals don't possess a psychology complex enough to experience the emotional catharsis required to return as undead without intervention from an outside force. Mass extinction can serve as that outside force.

Humanoids clear-cutting an entire forest or a seaside community wiping out a species critical to their ecosystem can spawn a verdorite. The collective spiritual energy and emotional distress of a dying biome powers these undead, formed as conglomerates or representatives.

action->Wavesense (Imprecise) 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.VdSMQ6yRZ3YXNXHL]
Wavesense (Imprecise) 100 feet

action->Necrotic Runoff.name: Necrotic Runoff
action->Necrotic Runoff.description: 60 feet. A seetangeist secretes foul fluids into the surrounding water, poisoning it. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical failure). Creatures that breathe water take a -2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. As long as a creature remains in the aura, it can't reduce its sickened condition below 1. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

action->Putrid Assault.name: Putrid Assault
action->Putrid Assault.description: Each enemy in the seetangeist's space takes @Damage[3d6[slashing],3d6[poison]]{3d6 slashing and 3d6 poison damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true]). A creature that fails this save also takes @Damage[1d12[persistent,poison]].

Shadern Immolator.name: Shadern Immolator
Shadern Immolator.publicNotes:
Goblin mortics have blackened, charred flesh and smoldering burns all over their body, as if they'd been burned alive. They are highly flammable but inured to the pain, and they enjoy lighting themselves (and everything else) on fire.

Mortics are humanoids overwhelmed by void energy who tenaciously cling to life, straddling the line between living and dead.

action->Consecration Vulnerability.name: Consecration Vulnerability
action->Consecration Vulnerability.description: A shadern in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y3jlOfgsQH1JjkJE]{Sanctified Ground}, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The shadern ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Death Gasp.name: Death Gasp
action->Death Gasp.description:
The shadern draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The shadern gains the undead trait and becomes immune to bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, poison, and sleep. Any such effects the shadern is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath.

Death Gasp lasts as long as the shadern holds their breath (up to 8 rounds).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lyeRL7khixdlJsaf]{Effect: Death Gasp}

action->Exhale.name: Exhale
action->Exhale.description: The shadern exhales a cloud of thick smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} centered on them. The cloud remains in place for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. Exhaling ends Death Gasp, as the shadern ceases holding their breath.

action->Smoldering Fist.name: Smoldering Fist
action->Smoldering Fist.description: On a critical hit, the shadern immolator's fist Strike also deals 1d4 persistent fire damage.

Shattered Window.name: Shattered Window
Shattered Window.description: The anger trapped within a structure shatters a window, showering glass in adjacent spaces.
Shattered Window.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:19|name:Suppress the Spiritual Energy] or @Check[type:religion|dc:19|name:Suppress the Spiritual Energy] (trained) to suppress the spiritual energy or @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:20|name:Soothe the Latent Anger] (trained) to soothe the latent anger
Shattered Window.stealth: (trained) to notice cracks spider-webbing across the window

action->Shatter.name: Shatter
action->Shatter.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to the window

Effect The window shatters, dealing @Damage[(2d6+5)[slashing]] damage to creatures within 5 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]).

Shredskin.name: Shredskin
Shredskin.publicNotes: Shredskins are flying, flapping animate skins who wander the lands lamenting their fate and feeling hollow and adrift, as if they're missing something crucial inside them. They try to enshroud and seize humanoid bodies—either corpses or living creatures, anything to fill that void within themselves. Though many will take any body they can overpower, some know who created them and desire only that body to claim as their own, the truest fulfillment of their accursed nature. Shredskins come from people skinned as inhumane trophies, or who were killed in a gruesome way that left only their skin intact, such as being pulled into a machine and degloved.

action->Compression.name: Compression
action->Compression.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning]], @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Control Body.name: Control Body
action->Control Body.description:
Requirements The shredskin is in the same space as a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse as a new skin and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities. Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally. The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 Hit Points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points. Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding at a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC (typically 18).

action->Enshroud.name: Enshroud
action->Enshroud.description:
Requirements The shredskin is restraining a creature

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} creature like a shirt, seizing control. The shredskin rolls an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature becomes restrained until it Escapes and the shredskin can control the creature as described in Control Body. At the start of each of its turns, the shredskin can attempt to Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action. An enshrouded creature can attempt a DC 16 Escape check to break free (DC 18 if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).

Siabrae.name: Siabrae
Siabrae.publicNotes:
A siabrae is a determined and merciless foe, bound by a twisted sense of duty to nature so strong that it drove them to commit unspeakable acts and arise as an undead menace.

A siabrae is an abomination. A skeletal druid or wild witch, with bones the texture of stone and antlers of rock rising from their rough skulls, they're people who have willingly paid the ultimate price to protect the natural world. It rarely goes well for them.

Druids and wild witches protect Golarion's environment from a host of threats—demonic invasions and undead horrors, otherworldly corruptions, and mundane greed and cupidity. Sometimes, they're tested beyond what they can bear, faced with forces they're incapable of defeating. Such a druid, seeing everything they have protected fall to destruction, might try the unthinkable. They might perform the ritual known as Welcome the Blighted Soul.

With desperate prayer and a gory blood sacrifice, the druid becomes a siabrae, taking the corruption of the land into themself and binding both together, so they might survive and fight monsters in nature's service. A small few are able to use their newfound power to save their lands, and so the ritual's legend grows. Much more often, the druid becomes a twisted guardian of something past saving, the land they protect a macabre parody of healthy nature. Most siabraes are proud and bitter, obsessed with duty and branding their living brethren as cowards and traitors.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Tanzende Lichter
spell->Dancing Lights.description:
Du erschaffst eine Lichtkugel, die in einem Umkreis von 20 Fuß/6 m helles Licht (und in den nächsten 20 Fuß/6 m Dämmerlicht) in einer Farbe deiner Wahl ausstrahlt. Wenn du das Licht im selben Raum wie eine willige Kreatur erschaffst, kannst du das Licht an die Kreatur binden, so dass es in der Nähe der Kreatur schwebt, wenn sie sich bewegt. Du kannst den Zauber Aufrechterhalten, um das Licht bis zu 60 Fuß/18 m weit zu bewegen; du kannst es als Teil dieser Bewegung an eine Kreatur anheften oder von ihr lösen.

Du kannst den Zauber Aufheben. Wenn du den Zauber wirkst, während du bereits vier Lichtzauber aktiv hast, musst du einen der bestehenden Zauber zum Beenden wählen.

Erhöhung (4.) Die Kugel spendet Licht in einem Radius von 60 Fuß/18 m (und Dämmerlicht für die nächsten 18 m).

consumable->Scroll of True Seeing (Level.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4sGIy77COooxhQuC]
Scroll of True Seeing (Level 6)
consumable->Scroll of True Seeing (Level.consumableSpellDescription: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
consumable->Scroll of True Seeing (Level.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4sGIy77COooxhQuC]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

action->Miasma.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.Es8g7kZrLAuNdiD1]
Miasma
action->Miasma.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.Es8g7kZrLAuNdiD1]

20 foot, @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37]{DC equal to the siabrae's spell DC - 4}.

A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn there becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a failure (or sickened 4 on a critical failure). An animal, fey, or plant that rolls a failure gets a critical failure instead. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the siabrae's miasma for 1 minute.

action->Rejuvenation.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.gbKpCw21tEmehq6e]
Rejuvenation

action->Blight Mastery.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.jciRdEHgGNGFXLsg]
Blight Mastery

action->Earth Glide.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.DIYZNvVP28U2UnDb]
Earth Glide

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the siabrae's spellcasting action, the siabrae attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

action->Stony Shards.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.WUXY9F8SLVQSC2b8]
Stony Shards
action->Stony Shards.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.WUXY9F8SLVQSC2b8]

Tiny shards break off the siabrae's antlers when they attack, lodging in the target's wounds and inflicting a terrible curse. A creature damaged by a siabrae's stone antlers Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a failure. If the creature critically fails, or fails while already clumsy 2 or greater, the creature is petrified.

Silent Stalker.name: Silent Stalker
Silent Stalker.languages: any one spoken in life by their murderer (typically common; can't speak)
Silent Stalker.publicNotes:
When a person is betrayed and killed in a way that their voice was silenced (such as through strangulation by a lover or close confidante), they might come back as a silent stalker. A silent stalker is a horrifying, twisted likeness of the person they were in life, with one obvious difference: the silent stalker has no mouth, simply a smooth patch of flesh where a mouth should be. Sound is suppressed in an area around a silent stalker, but once someone notices the quiet, it's often too late.

A revenant is a vengeful undead who stalks the one who killed them in life. They're relentless in the pursuit of their murderer, seeking a final justice.

action->Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
action->Self-Loathing.description:
If a silent stalker sees their own reflection or any object important to them in life, they must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The pale stranger is unaffected and can no longer be affected by that reflection or object in this way.

Success The silent stalker is distracted by self-loathing and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The silent stalker becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the source of their self-loathing and does everything they can to destroy it until the end of their next turn.

Critical Failure The silent stalker becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as long as the source of their self-loathing is apparent, until they're attacked, or until they see their murderer.

action->Sense Murderer.name: Sense Murderer
action->Sense Murderer.description: A silent stalker knows the direction of their murderer (as long as both are on the same plane), but not the distance.

action->Silent Aura.name: Silent Aura
action->Silent Aura.description:
10 feet. A silent stalker makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing them using hearing or a similar sense alone. This silence stops all sound within it or passing through. The silent stalker and all creatures in the aura can't use sonic attacks or actions that have the auditory trait; this prevents creatures from casting spells with verbal components or activating items with command components.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YKCsmlMgI0aS7joO]{Effect: Silent Aura}

action->Undying Vendetta.name: Undying Vendetta
action->Undying Vendetta.description: If the silent stalker's murderer dies, the pale stranger is immediately destroyed. A pale stranger that can't sense their murderer must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] once every 24 hours to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; they immediately rise again once they can sense their murderer. A murderer who becomes undead does not trigger the silent stalker's destruction until the murderer is finally destroyed. The silent stalker gains a +2 status bonus to checks and DCs against their murderer.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(3d8+7)[bludgeoning]], @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Implacable Advance.name: Implacable Advance
action->Implacable Advance.description: The silent stalker Strides twice and makes a claw Strike; they can ignore difficult terrain during these Strides if they advance toward their murderer. If they Strike and Grab their murderer this turn, they can Constrict as a free action immediately after the Grab.

Siphoning Spirit.name: Siphoning Spirit
Siphoning Spirit.description: A formless spirit drains life from the living, becoming progressively visible as its victims weaken.
Siphoning Spirit.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:48] (expert) or @Check[type:religion|dc:48] (expert) to weaken the spirit; four total successes are required to disable the haunt
Siphoning Spirit.reset: After 1 minute, the spirit is satiated, and the haunt deactivates as it returns to a resting state. Over the course of 1 hour, the spirit's siphoned life energy disperses and the haunt resets.
Siphoning Spirit.routine:
(1 action; death, divine, necromancy, void) The spirit inhales, siphoning the souls of the living and becoming more visible. Each creature within @Template[type:burst|distance:60]{60 feet} takes @Damage[(4d10+20)[void]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41|traits:death,divine,necromancy,void,damaging-effect] save. If no creatures are within the area, the haunt moves up to 120 feet into the largest concentration of living creatures and then inhales.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and increases its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} value by 1, to a maximum of drained 4.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and increases its drained value by 2, to a maximum of drained 4. If the creature was already drained 4, it dies.

action->Sudden Siphon.name: Sudden Siphon
action->Sudden Siphon.description:
Trigger A living creature passes within 15 feet of the spirit

Effect The invisible spirit latches onto the life essence of the living, dealing @Damage[(4d10+20)[void]] damage to all living creatures within @Template[type:burst|distance:60]{60 feet} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:41|basic:true] save). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Skeletal Mage.name: Skelettmagier
Skeletal Mage.publicNotes:
In seltenen Fällen kann aus den Knochen eines Zauberwirkers ein Skelett erschaffen werden, das eine begrenzte Fähigkeit zum Wirken von Magie beibehält. Diese Zauber sind fast immer offensiver Natur und der Skelettmagier setzt sie mit rücksichtsloser Hingabe ein. Skelettmagier werden oft fälschlicherweise für Leichname gehalten. Obwohl sie jedoch nicht annähernd so gerissen und tödlich sind, stellen sie dennoch eine große Gefahr für ihre Feinde dar.

Unter den Toten gibt es nirgendwo sonst eine so große Anzahl noch eine so breite Vielfalt, wie bei den Skeletten. Während die meisten fast ausschließlich aus Knochen bestehen, haben einige noch ein paar Fetzen Fleisch, die ihnen bei der Fortbewegung helfen, wie z. B. Flügelmembranen.

Skeletal Soldier.name: Skelettsoldat
Skeletal Soldier.publicNotes:
Diese Soldaten folgen auch im Tod noch ihren Befehlen und führen die Waffen, die sie im Laufe ihres Lebens zu benutzen gelernt haben. Sie werden häufig aus den Knochen von Menschen oder Zwergen hergestellt, aber auch andere Humanoide wie Grottenschrate, Hobgoblins und Orks sind recht häufig vertreten. Oft führen diese Soldaten die in ihrem Volk am weitesten verbreiteten Waffen und nicht die hier aufgeführten.

Unter den Toten gibt es nirgendwo sonst eine so große Anzahl noch eine so breite Vielfalt, wie bei den Skeletten. Während die meisten fast ausschließlich aus Knochen bestehen, haben einige noch ein paar Fetzen Fleisch, die ihnen bei der Fortbewegung helfen, wie z. B. Flügelmembranen.

action->Set Defense.name: Set Defense
action->Set Defense.description: The skeletal soldier sets its glaive (or other reach weapon) to defend the area around it. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction for that weapon only. This lasts until the skeleton takes an action with the move or attack trait or is destroyed.

Skeletal Titan.name: Titanenskelett
Skeletal Titan.publicNotes:
Nur die Mächtigen und Törichten würden die Knochen eines mächtigen Titanen oder einer ähnlich gigantischen Kreatur als Skelett aufrichten. Erfahrene Anwender der Nekromantie erkennen jedoch die Verschwendung eines solch mächtigen toten Körpers und statten diese auch mit der Magie des Luftwandelns aus, die auf der von Titanen basiert. Die Weisen unter ihnen wissen allerdings, dass es fast unmöglich ist, einen solchen Koloss zu kontrollieren, und dass dieser seinen Schöpfer genauso wahrscheinlich unter seinem mächtigen Fuß zerquetschen wird, wie er dessen Feinde erschlagen kann.

Unter den Toten gibt es nirgendwo sonst eine so große Anzahl noch eine so breite Vielfalt, wie bei den Skeletten. Während die meisten fast ausschließlich aus Knochen bestehen, haben einige noch ein paar Fetzen Fleisch, die ihnen bei der Fortbewegung helfen, wie z. B. Flügelmembranen.

action->Bone Debris.name: Bone Debris
action->Bone Debris.description: The bones a skeletal titan throws are large enough to clutter the battlefield. When the skeletal titan hits a creature with a bone attack, the projectile becomes difficult terrain in the square the creature occupies (or, if the creature occupies more than one square, one square it occupies of the titan's choice). If the titan misses with a bone attack, instead a random square adjacent to the creature becomes difficult terrain.

action->Mountain Slam.name: Mountain Slam
action->Mountain Slam.description: The skeletal titan slams its mountain sword into the ground. The shock wave reverberates, dealing mountain sword damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:20] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]). Those who fail are also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Huge or smaller, foot, @Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Sluagh Reaper.name: Sluagh Reaper
Sluagh Reaper.publicNotes:
Most sluagh are reapers: powerful killers subservient to their queen. After they collect souls on a hunt, they dutifully return their plunder to the queen. Though quite clever, they're inscrutable, lacking the whimsy and sociability that characterize many living fey. They do show merriment on occasion though, giggling as their claws draw closer to their quarry's throat.

A soul about to leave its physical body gives off a peculiar scent, usually unnoticed by mortal creatures. But the undead fey called sluagh can smell and track down its location with frightening ease. Unlike most fey, sluagh are undead, possessing strong connections to void energy and mortal souls. Sluagh collect the souls of those close to death and bring them to feed their queen.

Most sluagh appear bald-headed, with rounded ears, sharp teeth, glossy black eyes, and scrawny bodies. Their rib cages show through their skin, which is translucent and soft as velvet.

Sluagh can become ghostly and incorporeal for brief periods. They use this power to stalk their prey to great effect. Sometimes the glimpse of a sluagh is mistaken for a ghost sighting.

action->Frightful Presence.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]

30 feet. @Check[type:will|dc:26]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

action->Soulscent (Imprecise) 100 feet.name: Soulscent (Imprecise) 100 feet
action->Soulscent (Imprecise) 100 feet.description: The sluagh is aware of all @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} creatures, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} creatures, and creatures that died within the last hour within the listed range.

action->Ghostly Swoop.name: Ghostly Swoop
action->Ghostly Swoop.description:
The sluagh reaper becomes incorporeal until the start of their next turn, and Flies up to their fly Speed. While incorporeal, they are immune to precision damage, and have resistance 10 to all damage (except force, ghost touch, or vitality); this resistance is doubled against non-magical damage.

After using Ghostly Swoop, the sluagh reaper can't use it again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The sluagh reaper deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Steal Soul.name: Steal Soul
action->Steal Soul.description:
The sluagh reaper touches a dying creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour. If the target is a dying creature, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save-on a failure, its dying value increases by 1 (2 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, it receives no save and the sluagh imprisons its soul in a small, grimy sack that keeps stolen souls fresh.

The sack is magically locked. Any sluagh can open it without difficulty, but any others must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick the Lock} (@Check[type:thievery|dc:35|traits:action:pick-a-lock]) or use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 32). A creature can Interact to empty an unlocked sack, which frees the souls but doesn't return them to life. While a soul is imprisoned, it can't be brought back to life by any means short of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}. The sack can hold 12 souls at a time. Sluagh reapers typically attempt to return the souls to a queen so she can devour them.

Spirit Cyclone.name: Spirit Cyclone
Spirit Cyclone.description: A cyclone of angry spirits surges around the area.
Spirit Cyclone.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:30] (trained) or @Check[type:religion|dc:30] (trained) to weaken the haunt; three total successes in any combination are required to disable the haunt
Spirit Cyclone.reset: The spirit cyclone disperses after 1 minute and resets after 1 day.
Spirit Cyclone.routine: (3 actions) The spirit cyclone uses 3 actions to move, traveling up to 30 feet with each action and dealing @Damage[(2d10+13)[void]] damage to each creature in its path (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save). A creature needs to attempt only one save during the cyclone's movement, even if the cyclone moves over its space more than once. On a critical failure, a creature is swept up into the cyclone, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 32). A creature grabbed by the cyclone moves along with the cyclone and takes @Damage[(1d10+6)[void]] damage at their beginning of its turn, and it must attempt a Reflex save against the cyclone on the cyclone's turn, no matter where the cyclone moves. A creature that successfully Escapes from the cyclone falls from a height of [[/r {1d12*5} #Falling Distance]]{1d12 x 5 feet}.

action->Gather Spirit.name: Gather Spirit
action->Gather Spirit.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures enter the area

Effect A spiraling column of spirits gather, becoming a whirling cyclone of souls @Template[type:burst|distance:5]{10 feet wide} and 60 feet tall. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Sykever.name: Sykever
Sykever.publicNotes:
Die am weitesten verbreiteten Darvakka sind Sykever, die sogenannten Nachtschreiter. Blutrünstig, aber berechnend, führen sie Legionen von Toten in die Schlacht auf der Materiellen Ebene und arbeiten auf das einfache Ziel hin, alles Leben zu beenden.

Darvakka, auch Nachtschatten genannt, sind ein gefräßiges Übel, das zu gleichen Teilen aus Dunkelheit und Bosheit besteht. Ursprünglich Kreaturen der Äußeren Ebenen, die zur Konvergenz zwischen der Schattenebene und der Ebene der Negativen Energie reisen - wo die Macht des Nichts sie auslöscht - sind diese untoten Abscheulichkeiten die physische Verkörperung der Entropie. Sie brennen mit einem intensiven Hass auf alles Leben und arbeiten daran, eine letzte, dunkle Nacht über die Materielle Ebene zu bringen, in der nichts als Asche und Eis zurückbleibt. Als von Dunkelheit und Schatten zerfressene Kreaturen, haben Darvakka eine große Abneigung gegen Sonnenlicht und alle Quellen positiver Energie. Auf der Materiellen Ebene verbringen sie die Stunden des Tageslichts versteckt unter der Erde, inmitten von Ruinen oder tief in den dunkelsten Abgründen des Ozeans, außerhalb der Reichweite der Sonnenstrahlen; von dort aus tauchen sie erst auf, wenn die Dunkelheit über ihnen hereinbricht. Darvakka haben eine Aura der Entropie, die untote Sklaven anzieht, die dann als Krieger und Herolde dienen. Sie gehen nur selten Bündnisse untereinander oder mit anderen Kreaturen ein und leben in Einsamkeit als Anführer ihrer eigenen Armeen der Toten.

spell->Plane Shift (to the Universe, Voi.name: <Compendium> (ausschließlich ins Universum, Die Leere oder Das Grau)
spell->Plane Shift (to the Universe, Voi.target: 1 bereitwillige Kreatur oder bis zu 8 bereitwillige Kreaturen, die sich bei den Händen nehmen

action->Entropy's Shadow.name: Schatten der Entropie
action->Entropy's Shadow.description: 40 Fuß/12 m. Die bloße Existenz eines Sykever verströmt Entropie und Verderbnis. Lebende Kreaturen, welche die Aura der Entropie des Sykever betreten oder ihren Zug innerhalb des Wirkungsbereichs der Aura beginnen, erleiden @Damage[4d6[void]]{4W6 Punkte Leerenschaden} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true]{einfacher Zähigkeitswurf}). Bei einem Fehlschlag erleidet die Kreatur zusätzlich für 1 Minute den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 1} und wird 10 Fuß/3 m in Richtung des Sykever gezogen.

action->Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Machtlos im Sonnenlicht
action->Sunlight Powerlessness.description: Ein Sykever, der dem direkten Sonnenlicht ausgesetzt ist, erleidet die Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 2} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 2}.

action->Change Posture.name: Haltung wechseln
action->Change Posture.description: Der Sykever wechselt zwischen seiner zwei- und vierbeinigen Haltung. In seiner zweibeinigen Haltung kann der Sykever sämtliche in den Spielwerten angegebenen Fähigkeiten mit Ausnahme des Gehörnten Ansturms einsetzen. Nimmt der Sykever seine vierbeinige Haltung ein, erhält er eine Bewegungsrate von 80 Fuß/24 m, kann jedoch weder seinen Angriff mit den Armstacheln noch die Fähigkeit Gegenstand durchbohren oder die Aktion Entwaffnen nutzen. Gleichsam kann er keine Zauber wirken.

action->Crush Item.name: Gegenstand durchbohren
action->Crush Item.description:
Auslöser Der Sykever erzielt einen Kritischen Erfolg beim @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Entwaffnen}

Anforderung Der Sykever befindet sich in seiner zweibeinigen Haltung

Effekt Der Sykever schnappt den Gegenstand und spießt ihn mit seinen Armstacheln auf. Der Gegenstand wird dadurch Beschädigt und fällt innerhalb der Angriffsfläche des Sykevers auf den Boden. Bereits beschädigte Gegenstände werden durch diese Fähigkeit nicht weiter zerstört; zudem sind sämtliche Gegenstände der Härte 14 oder höher nicht davon betroffen.

action->Draining Gaze.name: Entkräftender Blick
action->Draining Gaze.description:
Der Sykever fokussiert seinen Albtraum erregenden Blick auf eine für ihn sichtbare Kreatur. Sein Ziel muss einen @Check[type:will|dc:36]{Willenswurf} ablegen. Unabhängig vom Ergebnis des Rettungswurfes ist die Kreatur anschließend vorübergehend für 10 Minuten gegen den Effekt dieser Fähigkeit immun.

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel wird vom Effekt nicht beeinflusst.

Erfolg Das Ziel erleidet für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 2}, wenn sich der Sykever in seiner zweibeinigen Haltung befindet; hat der Sykever seine vierbeinige Haltung eingenommen, erleidet das Ziel stattdessen für 1 Runde den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 2}.

Fehlschlag Wie beim Erfolg, der Effekt hält jedoch 1 Minute lang an.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Erfolg, jedoch mit den Zuständen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 3} oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 3} sowie einer Wirkungsdauer des Effekts von 10 Minuten.

action->Horned Rush.name: Gehörnter Ansturm
action->Horned Rush.description:
Anforderung Der Sykever hat seine vierbeinige Haltung angenommen

Effekt Der Sykever nutzt die Aktion Laufen, um sich fortzubewegen. Am Ende dieser Bewegung führt er einen Hornangriff aus.

Taunting Skull.name: Spottender Schädel
Taunting Skull.languages: eine beliebige Sprache aus der Zeit als Sterblicher
Taunting Skull.publicNotes:
Einige Enthauptete werden mit weitgehend intakten geistigen Fähigkeiten erweckt. Diese ausgefuchsten Untoten provozieren ihre Opfer oft dazu, dummerweise die Verfolgung aufzunehmen oder sich selbst zu verletzen.

Enthauptete sind körperlose, schwebende Köpfe, die in Untote verwandelt wurden. Sie sind perfekte Kandidaten für das „Projekt Diener“ eines Nekromanten, da die Kosten für ihre Erschaffung gering und sie unendlich anpassbar sind. In jeder Höhle, die lange von praktizierenden Nekromanten bewohnt wird, ist es nicht ungewöhnlich, eine Handvoll schwebender Köpfe zu finden, von denen jeder völlig unterschiedliche Eigenschaften und sogar einen gewissen Grad an Erfahrungszuwachs bei ihrer Erschaffung aufweist.

action->Bite Back.name: Zurückbeißen
action->Bite Back.description:
Auslöser Der Spottende Schädel wird von einer Kreatur innerhalb seines Angriffsradius attackiert

Effekt Der Spottende Schädel reagiert mit einem Bissangriff gegen diese Kreatur.

action->Incessant Goading.name: Unentwegtes Anstacheln
action->Incessant Goading.description:
Der Schädel wählt eine Kreatur im Umkreis von 60 Fuß/18 m zu sich aus und bringt diese schonungslos mit nervenden Sticheleien gegen sich auf. Das Ziel muss einen @Check[type:will|dc:22]{Willenswurf} ablegen, wenn es dem Effekt widerstehen will.

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist vom Effekt dieser Fähigkeit nicht betroffen und vorübergehend für 1 Minute dagegen immun.

Erfolg Das Ziel ist vom Effekt dieser Fähigkeit nicht betroffen.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel gilt für 1 Runde als @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß}. Sollte sich der Spottende Schädel bei ihrem nächsten Zug innerhalb des Angriffsradius der Kreatur befinden, greift diese den Schädel wild und unkontrolliert so oft wie möglich an.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Fehlschlag, das Ziel führt jedoch auch unmittelbar einen Angriff gegen sich selbst aus; dieser Angriff erfordert kein Aufwenden von Aktionen.

Toppling Furniture.name: Toppling Furniture
Toppling Furniture.description: A mischievous spirit pushes a bookshelf over onto a creature.
Toppling Furniture.disable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:16|name:Hold the furniture upright] to hold the furniture upright or @Check[type:occultism|dc:18|name:Foil the spirit's influence] (trained) to foil the spirit's efforts to influence matter
Toppling Furniture.reset: If the haunt successfully damages a creature with Topple Furniture, the spirit laughs for [[/br 1d4 #Laughing Duration]]{1d4 rounds} as the haunt resets; each subsequent time the haunt activates, it must topple a different piece of upright furniture. If the haunt fails to damage a creature, the spirit wails in frustration and resets after pouting for [[/br 1d4 #Haunt Reset]]{1d4 hours}.
Toppling Furniture.stealth: (trained) to hear the spirit's grunt of exertion as it works to topple the furniture

action->Topple Furniture.name: Topple Furniture
action->Topple Furniture.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to the furniture

Effect The spirit shoves the furniture over in an attempt to crush the triggering creature. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(2d10+7)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true]). On a failure, the creature is additionally knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Tormented (Burning).name: Gepeinigter (Verbrennen)
Tormented (Burning).publicNotes: Die Gepeinigten sind entstellte Karikaturen von Lebewesen, die aus den Überresten der zu Tode Gefolterten entstehen.
